name: Triamcinolone Acetonide
indications: triamcinolone acetonide cream indicated relief inflammatory pruritic manifestations corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses .
contraindications: apply triamcinolone acetonide cream 0.025 % affected area two four times daily . rub gently . apply 0.1 % 0.5 % triamcinolone acetonide cream , appropriate , affected area two three times daily . rub gently . occlusive dressing technique occlusive dressings may used management psoriasis recalcitrant conditions . gently rub small amount cream lesion disappears . reapply preparation leaving thin coating lesion , cover pliable nonporous film , seal edges . needed , additional moisture may provided covering lesion dampened clean cotton cloth nonporous film applied briefly wetting affected area water immediately prior applying medication . frequency changing dressings best determined individual basis . may convenient apply triamcinolone acetonide cream occlusive dressing evening remove dressing morning ( i.e . , 12-hour occlusion ) . utilizing 12-hour occlusion regimen , additional cream applied , without occlusion , day . reapplication essential dressing change . infection develops , occlusive dressings discontinued appropriate antimicrobial therapy instituted .
warningsAndPrecautions: triamcinolone acetonide cream usp , 0.1 % 80 gram tubes ndc 68071-3852-8 store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . avoid excessive heat . protect freezing . manufactured : northstar rx llc . memphis , tn 38141. manufactured : macleods pharmaceuticals limited oxalis labs baddi , himachal pradesh , india report suspect , contact northstar rx llc 1-800-206-7821 fda 1-800-fda-1088 www.fda.gov/medwatch revised : december 2023
adverseReactions: topical corticosteroids contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity components preparation .
indications_original: Triamcinolone Acetonide Cream is indicated for the relief of the inflammatory and pruritic manifestations of corticosteroid-responsive dermatoses.
contraindications_original:
Apply Triamcinolone Acetonide Cream 0.025% to the affected area two to four times daily. Rub in gently.
                  Apply the 0.1% or the 0.5% Triamcinolone Acetonide Cream, as appropriate, to the affected area two to three times daily. Rub in gently.
                  
                     Occlusive Dressing Technique
                  
                  Occlusive dressings may be used for the management of psoriasis or other recalcitrant conditions. Gently rub a small amount of cream into the lesion until it disappears.
                  Reapply the preparation leaving a thin coating on the lesion, cover with pliable nonporous film, and seal the edges. If needed, additional moisture may be provided by covering the lesion with a dampened clean cotton cloth before the nonporous film is applied or by briefly wetting the affected area with water immediately prior to applying the medication. The frequency of changing dressings is best determined on an individual basis. It may be convenient to apply triamcinolone acetonide cream under an occlusive dressing in the evening and to remove the dressing in the morning (i.e., 12-hour occlusion). When utilizing the 12-hour occlusion regimen, additional cream should be applied, without occlusion, during the day. Reapplication is essential at each dressing change. If an infection develops, the use of occlusive dressings should be discontinued and appropriate antimicrobial therapy instituted.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Triamcinolone Acetonide Cream USP, 0.1%
                  
                  80 gram tubes NDC 68071-3852-8
                  
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Avoid excessive heat.
                  
                  
                     PROTECT FROM FREEZING.
                  
                  
                  
                     Manufactured for:
                     
Northstar Rx LLC.
  
Memphis, TN 38141.

                  To report SUSPECT ADVERSE REACTIONS, contact NorthStar Rx LLC 1-800-206-7821 or FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch
                  
                  
                  Revised: December 2023
adverseReactions_original: Topical corticosteroids are contraindicated in those patients with a history of hypersensitivity to any of the components of the preparation.
